trait.name: Charge
entries: If Romul moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, Romul can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: Romul deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Bloodlust
entries: Each successful attack by Romul generates a +1 bonus to its attack rolls (to a maximum of +5) and a +2 to its damage rolls (to a maximum of +10) to its first attack on its next turn. If the Romul misses with an attack or fails to attack, it loses these bonuses and starts again.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the Romul fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Brothers Forever
entries: Romul has advantage on attack rolls if Rem is within 30 feet of him and Rem isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Relentless (1/day)
entries: If Romul reduced to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Romul makes three attacks: two with its greataxe and one gore attack.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 8 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Unbreakable Will (1/day)
entries: If Romul fails a saving throw that would cause him to become {@condition paralyzed}, {@condition restrained}, {@condition stunned} or asleep, he automatically suceeds instead and becomes resistant to all damage. This resistance lasts until the end of next turn of the creature that forced him to make this saving throw.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Rem is a 8th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If Rem fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Nature's Fury
entries: When Rem casts a druid spell, it can make one Shillelagh Staff attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Brothers Forever
entries: Rem has advantage on attack rolls if Romul is within 30 feet of him and Romul isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Shillelagh Staff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Spell Reflection (3/day)
entries: If Rem makes a successful saving throw against a spell, or a spell attack misses it, Rem can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 30 feet of him. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of Rem. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes its own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

monster.name: Mordakhesh

vulnerable.note: from magic weapons wielded by good creatures

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mordakhesh's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks). Mordakhesh can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Mordakhesh can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless he wishes to be. Mordakhesh has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Mordakhesh fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: Mordakhesh can use its action to polymorph into a Small, Medium, Large or Huge humanoid, or back into its true form. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed.

trait.name: The Wyrmbreaker (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: When Mordakhesh is reduced to 0 hit points, he doesn't die or fall {@condition unconscious}. Instead, he regains 300 hit points. In addition, Mordakhesh puts on his helmet, activates his armor and changes his melee weapon to the Vairamhatyaara, gaining 200 temporary hit points, +3 to AC, access to new actions and his initiative becomes 20 if it was lower.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Mordakhesh makes three Greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Chromatic Orb
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 15} to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage of a type chosen by Mordakhesh: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Mordakhesh makes one weapon attack or casts Chromatic Orb or Chaos Orb.

legendary.name: Chromatic Resistance
entries: Modakhesh gains resistance to one damage type of his choice—acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder—until the start of his next turn.

legendary.name: Fiery Step (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Mordakhesh magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing and carrying, to an unoccupied space it can see within 30 feet of it and then makes one weapon attack or casts Chaos Orb.

mythicHeader: If Mordakhesh's mythic trait is active, he can use the actions below.

mythic.name: Mythic multiattack
entries: Mordakhesh makes three Vairamhatyaara attacks and casts Chaos Orb.

mythic.name: Vairamhatyaara
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 21} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d6 + 13}) slashing damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage. If the target is a dragon, Mordakhesh has advantage on this attack and deals 30 ({@damage 5d6 + 13}) slashing damage plus 16 ({@damage 3d10}) force damage instead.

mythic.name: Chaos Orb
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 18} to hit, range 60 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d8}) damage of a type chosen by Mordakhesh: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, thunder, necrotic or psychic.

mythic.name: Запустить кучу мечей сзади себя
entries: https://i.pinimg.com/564x/{@dice d9 / 32}/c5/{@dice d932}c{@dice 57d94}c2c018097cb075b4c6656a.jpg

In the age when fiends and dragons waged war across Eberron, rakshasas served the fiendish lords as strategists and generals. A rakshasa named Mordakhesh rose up through the ranks to become one of the greatest commanders of his age, and a dragon-slaying specialist. For this, he earned the nickname Shadowsword, along with a legendary reputation for leaving death in his wake.

Mordakhesh serves as the prakhutu or "speaker" of his imprisoned master, Rak Tulkhesh, and he seeks to free his lord by bathing the world in blood. Like a spider with multiple webs, he has agents and pawns (which he calls his "claws") established in armies across Khorvaire. The most significant of those is the barbarian horde he amasses in the Demon Wastes—warriors who threaten to sweep into Aundair on a tide of blood.

Many of the horrors of the Last War were instigated—or at least encouraged—by Mordakhesh's operatives, and his claws are known to have perpetrated some of the most brutal massacres of that conflict. No one knows how far the Shadowsword's reach extends, or which commanders in the armies of Khorvaire serve him.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Powerful Blows
entries: When the tarrasque hits a Huge or smaller creature or object with an attack that isn't a bite, the target must make a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target is pushed up to 15 feet away from the tarrasque and is knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The tarrasque regains 100 hit points at the start of each of its turn. The tarrasque can only die if it is reduced to 0 hit points and a {@spell wish} spell is used to keep it dead.

trait.name: Destroy
entries: As a bonus action, the tarrasque can make an attack that isn't a bite against an object or structure.

trait.name: Aura of Earthbinding
entries: Any creature or object within 200 feet of the tarrasque has its flying speed halved. Any creature in this aura that is more than 20 feet above the ground or the tarrasque at the end of its turn falls to an altitude of 20 feet automatically.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite, and it can replace any attack with an improvised attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 10}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage. This attack is a critical hit on a roll of 18-20 on the {@dice d20}.

action.name: Improvised Attack
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft. or range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.

If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

legendary.name: Savage (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarrasque makes a non-bite weapon attack against each creature, object, and structure within 20 feet of it.

monster.name: Sentinel Marshal
languages: plus up to two other languages

spellcasting.name: Guardian's Shield (1/Day).
headerEntries: The Sentinel Marshal can innately cast {@spell shield|phb} spell. Its innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom.

spellcasting.name: Dragonmark Reservoir
headerEntries: The Sentinel Marshal's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}). It can use {@item Dragonmark Reservoir|exploringeberron} to cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Deni Shield
entries: The Sentinel Marshal has the {@item Sentinel Shield} magic item that gives it advantage on initiative rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks. It uses the innate power of Mark of Sentinel, and therefore only humans with the Mark of Sentinel can use it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sentinel Marshal makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 15 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Vigilant Guardian (1/Day)
entries: When a creature the Sentinel Marshal can see within 5 feet of it is hit by an attack roll, the Sentinel Marshal can use its reaction to swap places with that creature, and the Sentinel Marshal is hit by the attack instead.

Veterans are professional fighters that take up arms for pay or to protect something they believe in or value. Their ranks include soldiers retired from long service and warriors who never served anyone but themselves.

monster.name: Sentinel Marshal Commander
languages: plus up to two other languages

spellcasting.name: Guardian's Shield (1/Day).
headerEntries: The Sentinel Marshal Commander can innately cast {@spell shield|phb} spell. Its innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom.

spellcasting.name: Channeling Wand
headerEntries: The Sentinel Marshal Commander's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). It can use {@item Channeling Wand|exploringeberron} to cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Deni Shield
entries: The Sentinel Marshal Commander has the {@item Sentinel Shield} magic item that gives it advantage on initiative rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks. It uses the innate power of Mark of Sentinel, and therefore only humans with the Mark of Sentinel can use it.

trait.name: Marshall's Belt
entries: The Sentinel Marshal Commander has the {@item Belt of Hill Giant Strength} magic item that sets its Strength score to 21 (already included). Without it Sentinel Marshal Commander has the Strength score of 18. It uses the innate power of Mark of Sentinel, and therefore only humans with the Mark of Sentinel can use it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sentinel Marshal Commander makes two longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 16 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +2
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Vigilant Guardian (1/Day)
entries: When a creature the Sentinel Marshal Commander can see within 5 feet of it is hit by an attack roll, the Sentinel Marshal Commander  can use its reaction to swap places with that creature, and the Sentinel Marshal Commander  is hit by the attack instead.

Veterans are professional fighters that take up arms for pay or to protect something they believe in or value. Their ranks include soldiers retired from long service and warriors who never served anyone but themselves.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Véurr fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While Véurr remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a bump one the ceiling.

trait.name: Many Eyes
entries: Véurr has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Adamantine Plating
entries: Any critical hit against Véurr's body becomes a normal hit.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: Véurr is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Immobile
entries: Véurr is incapable of moving. Its speed is always 0 feet and it can't be increased beyond that. It cannot use any actions that require moving its body in any way and it can only be moved by means of a wish spell. It automatically fails all Dexterity saving throws if the spell targets its body.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Véurr's body can't be penetrated by spells of 5th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Véurr makes any combination of three Spike and Beam attacks.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 90 ft., one target. {@h}({@damage 4d6 + 10}) piercing and ({@damage 2d6}) force damage.

action.name: Beam
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120/360 ft., one target. {@h}({@damage 3d6 + 10}) force damage.

action.name: Calculated Strike
entries: {@atk mw} automatic hit, reach 60 ft., one target. {@h}{@dice 2d10 + 10} piercing and {@damage 1d10} force damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Véurr makes one Spike or Beam attack.

legendary.name: Adaptation
entries: Véurr's body gains immunity to one damage type of its choice until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Fast Calculations (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: Véurr makes one Calculated Strike attack.
